thread.title: Slower growth ahead for Sydney: McGrath
thread.title_full: Slower growth ahead for Sydney: McGrath

author: Aidan Devine
title: Slower growth ahead for Sydney: McGrath
text:
NSW’s strengthening economy and rising levels of migration will ensure Sydney property prices continue growing in the near future, despite persistent rumours of a housing bubble, predicts real estate kingpin John McGrath.
The McGrath Estate Agents founder and chief executive said the current housing boom wouldn’t last, but instead of coming to an abrupt end would gradually come off the boil.
“The boom will end at some point, but that doesn’t mean price growth will end, but rather continue in a more moderate fashion,” Mr McGrath said.
McGrath Estate Agents CEO John McGrath forecasts moderate growth in Sydney property prices. Pic: Tara Croser. Source: News Corp Australia
He added that a combination of domestic and international forces have ensured demand has remained strong, evidenced by record auction clearance rates over recent months. One of these factors is the “sleep at night factor” associated with investing in property, rather than other asset classes, which has made the market a safer bet for investors.
“As our dollar continues on a downward trend, I anticipate increased interest from expat and offshore buyers,” Mr McGrath said.
“[Problems] in Greece and the Eurozone have brought volatility back into the sharemarket, and I suspect this will continue to have a favourable impact on the demand for residential property.
“Sydney … has proven to be one of the most resilient property markets in the world with long term fundamentals that underpin the market.”
12 Wentworth Rd, Vaucluse is on the market for sale. McGrath’s network sold more than a $1 billion in real estate in Sydney’s eastern suburbs. Source: Supplied
Over the 2015 financial year Mr McGrath’s real estate network sold 11,760 properties across NSW, ACT and Queensland, totalling $12.3 billion — a 21.7 per cent increase on the $10.1 billion sold the previous year. More than 3000 of these sales were above $1 million and just short of a 1000 were above $2 million. There were 87 sales above $5 million.
McGrath Estate Agents sold almost 1000 homes worth $2 million or more. Source: News Limited
March was also the company’s biggest ever month for property transactions. It sold 1281 homes totalling $1.46 billion, smashing their previous record set in November 2014. The group opened 10 new offices over the financial year, eight in NSW and two in Queensland.
Their Edgecliff office alone, which sells homes mostly in Sydney’s eastern suburbs, sold $1.61 billion in real estate.
Originally published as How the housing boom will end
